column9: Ships are now working, here's how you create them:\n

column1: \n
HOW TO CREATE A NEW SHIP\n
01. Write the rooms for the ship itself and be sure to include the following rooms:\n
a)The room with the boarding plank...must be flagged with PLANK flag.\n
b)The room that the ship will be steered from...must be flagged HELM flag\n
02. All rooms in the ship must have the SHIP flag\n
03. Any rooms from which you should be able to see the room the ship is in should be flaged DECK\n
04. The vnums of the ship rooms should be continous..You can not use split groups of rooms like\n
200 to 215 + 230 to 240...you should use a range like 41800 to 41885 with none of the rooms in\n
that range exiting anywhere in the world outside of the ship.\n
05. Create an object of type 33 (ship)\n
06. Value 0 on the object should be set to the room number the player will go to when they enter the\n
ship.\n
07. Value 2 on the object should be set to the starting vnum of the rooms inside the ship object.\n
08. Value 3 on the object should be set to the ending vnum of the rooms inside the ship object\n
09. All other values should be left at zero.The code will manipulate them as needed.\n
10. The object should be set in the zone file for the area to load in a room that is not WATER_SWIM\n
or WATER_NOSWIM....it should however be one room away from a room with either of those sector\n
types.\n
11. There can only be one of each ship object on the mud.If you want additional ships, build them,\n
with their own unique object # and rooms inside.\n

column9: Some *rough* ideas for new mobprogs I've cooked up:\n

column1: \n
1) gleeman - pay to play music, tell stories.  music doesn't necessarily\n
have to mean singing - could just be occasional emotes as they play an\n
instrument in a common room, as a backdrop to RP without being too\n
interfering in the RP itself.  Could also go all the way up to full\n
performances meant for players to sit down and watch/list to, such as\n
some longer stories.\n
2) novice history lessons - approved lessons for WT Novices, of the\n
non-channeling variety shouldn't be too difficult.\n
3) lost child 'quest' - a little bit more involved than the missing\n
glasses in the Oval Plaza, a mom missing her child needs help tracking\n
them down - could even involve multiple mobs - "I last saw her at X's\n
shop."  player goes and talks to X, gets another clue to help track the\n
child down and return her.\n
4) help innkeeper - missing wagon/waiting on delivery for something.\n

My son was supposed to be back from town Z with some barrels of ale by
nightfall.  I'm afraid he had trouble with the wagon or ran into
brigands.
Go help him fix the wagon so he can get back.\n
5) beggar - give them money or food?  money gets a thanks, food gets\n
gratitude they remember later - maybe some other reward?  they give you\n
a piece of info, or an object they found?  maybe they flag you and\n
remember you to do something unexpected for you later?\n
6) illuminator - pay them to launch a fireworks display - potential for\n
signalling people across town, if somebody's smart enough to think of\n
that.  I would. :)\n
7) hey, you - carry a message to somebody for me.  Somebody asks you to\n
take a message, either a note or verbal relay, to another mob in town\n

8) innkeeper - rent a room.  Set up inns so players can rent rooms for\n

b) wanders around and quietly asks players if they have heard the latest\n
gossip - if they are interested, they can hear it from the mob.\n
10) town drunk, or even drunks in different taverns.  say random things,\n

11) vendor selling food at a street stand\n
12) female singer in a tavern - pay her to sing, knows a couple different\n
12) female singer in a tavern - pay her to sing, knows a couple different\n

13) messenger - pay them to carry word to somebody in the same city\n
14) pigeon keeper - pay them to send messages via pigeon to somebody in\n
another city.  go into their shop in Caemlyn, pay them, write a message\n
using the editor, they send it to another pigeon keeper in another city,\n

guild.  So, rather than calling somebody over guild chat, send a message\n
